input.description: access key [Optional] The AWS access key.
secret key [Optional] The AWS secret access key.

session token [Optional] : The AWS session token which is generally created for temporary access to users for role based authorization.
Please Note: The temporary access key , secret key and session token to be generated by the user to provide in adapter request.
Please refer below AWS docs for more details
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_temp_request.html
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/sts/assume-role.html
region [Optional] The region to communicate with.

instance id [Mandatory]
The ID of the instance to bundle.

bucket [Mandatory]
The bucket in which to store the AMI. You can specify a bucket that you already own or a new bucket that Amazon EC2 creates on your behalf. If you specify a bucket that belongs to someone else, Amazon EC2 returns an error.

prefix [Mandatory]
Specifies the beginning of the file name of the AMI.

aws access key id [Mandatory]
The Access Key ID of the owner of the Amazon S3 bucket.

secret access key [Mandatory]
Account's secret access key to sign the upload policy

expiration time [Mandatory]
The expiration of the upload policy. Recommended is 12 hours or longer.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <request-data> <amazon-ec2-rest-request> <xsl:if test="string-length('${access key}')>0"> <access-key>${access key}</access-key> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${secret key}')>0"> <secret-key>${secret key}</secret-key> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${session token}')>0 and string-length('${secret key}')>0 and string-length('${access key}')>0"> <session-token>${session token}</session-token> </xsl:if> <operation-name> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">bundle-instance</xsl:text> </operation-name> <xsl:if test="string-length('${region}')>0"> <region>${region}</region> </xsl:if> <parameters> <instance-id>${instance id}</instance-id> <storage> <S3> <bucket> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${bucket}</xsl:text> </bucket> <prefix>${prefix}</prefix> <aws-access-key-id>${aws access key id}</aws-access-key-id> <secret-access-key>${secret access key}</secret-access-key> <expiration-time>${expiration time}</expiration-time> </S3> </storage> </parameters> </amazon-ec2-rest-request> </request-data> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Bundles the Windows instance.During bundling, only the root store (C:\) is bundled. Data on other instance stores is not preserved. This procedure is not applicable for Linux and UNIX instances or Windows instances that use Amazon EBS volumes as their root devices.
